page.title: 18A smallholding
page.content: {Lees Barn}was built in 1890 on a little lane which turns off the A52 road near{Radcliffe-on-Trent.}One of its fields is called Lamcote Field and was once part of the Holme Pierrepont estate. Now Lees Barn is owned by Mr.& Mrs. Howard who have a smallholding there. The land is used mainly to keep chickens. There are 800 laying hens which live in long huts but can also wander round outside. We helped Mrs. Howard to collect the morning's eggs. We had to look carefully for them and found 30 on top of a haystack! We ended up with 230 eggs altogether. Mrs. Howard told us that it costs Â£500 to feed the hens each month.
